item.title: PostgreSQL Library v0.3.4.22
item.description:
Product: PostgreSQL Library v0.3.4.22
Company: JDP Science
Release Date: Mon, 03 May 2021 13:12:57 -0400
Packager: JDP Science

Description: Wrapping of libPQ for PostgreSQL access. Higher-level than libPQ itself. See Examples.

Follow this tutorial to install LibPQ on an NI Linux RT target :
https://forums.ni.com/t5/NI-Linux-Real-Time-Documents/Tutorial-PostgreSQL-with-LabVIEW/tac-p/4111331

Release Notes: 0.3.4:
- fix issues with PGPASS credentials UI
- look for "(" ")" in COPY column list

0.3.3:
- back save to LabVIEW 2016
- add support for pgpass credentials files (Issue #4)
- add support for COPY (issue #5)

Thanks to contributor Patrick Irvin (@ciozi137).

New in 0.2.2 :
- switch to LabVIEW 2017
- resolved issue #1 : add support for NI Linux RT Targets
- resolved issue #2 : add support for boolean parameter when executing single command with parameters
- resolved issue #3 : improved parameter detection

Thanks to contributor Antoine Chalons (@antoinechalons) for their work on this release.
item.dc:creator: JDP Science

item.title: postgreSQL/timescaleDB/S3 v1.4.0.22
item.description:
Product: postgreSQL/timescaleDB/S3 v1.4.0.22
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Fri, 09 Apr 2021 12:35:53 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin, Jack Maier, Phil Shenk

Description: VIs for interacting with postgreSQL /TimescaleDB/S3

Release Notes: - Change AWS configuration:
- "Read Credentials file.vi" is now "Read AWS Credentials File.vi"
- User does not provide path to credentials file; library manages the file location; the user only provides necessary keys if the file is missing.
- Minor changes to Administer Tables UI.vi (preparing for new features in next release)
- Updated package dependencies
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Cryostation v1.1.7.15
item.description:
Product: Cryostation v1.1.7.15
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Fri, 02 Apr 2021 11:09:21 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Program for logging Montana Instruments Cryostation status to the DSC. Provides a UI and API for getting information from the Cryostation.

Release Notes: [1.1.7]
- Update to Instrument v1.8.3.102
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.8.3.102
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.8.3.102
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Fri, 02 Apr 2021 10:32:24 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Method for communicate with a piece of hardware (provides a hardware abstraction layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either National Instruments' Simple Messaging Library (STM) or cross-platform protocol 0MQ)
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

The LevyLab Instrument Framework makes extensive use of JKI State Machines and JKI State Machine Objects.z

Release Notes: [1.8.3]
- Improvments to Configuration.lvclass:
- Bug fix Issue #32: Better handling of config files that have multiple sections
- Read method now drops onto block diagram with data to variant included
- New method "Default Path" provides path to User Application Data
- [build 100: remove missing file from configuration.lvclass]
- [build 101: change default configuration location to User Application Data]
- [build 102: fix issue with retention of class data from Handle Command.vi
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.8.3.101

Product: Instrument Framework v1.8.3.101
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Thu, 01 Apr 2021 16:16:15 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Method for communicate with a piece of hardware (provides a hardware abstraction layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either National Instruments' Simple Messaging Library (STM) or cross-platform protocol 0MQ)
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

The LevyLab Instrument Framework makes extensive use of JKI State Machines and JKI State Machine Objects.z

Release Notes: [1.8.3]
- Improvments to Configuration.lvclass:
- Bug fix Issue #32: Better handling of config files that have multiple sections
- Read method now drops onto block diagram with data to variant included
- New method "Default Path" provides path to User Application Data
- [build 100: remove missing file from configuration.lvclass]
- [build 101: change default configuration location to User Application Data]
